title: Direction
text: We can tell whether the parabola goes left or right based on the sign of a in the equation, $$x=a y^2+b y+c$$. If a is negative, then the parabola goes left, if it is positive, it goes right.
speech: We can tell whether the parabola goes left or right based on the sign of a in the equation,  x is equal to a y squared, plus b y plus c . If a is negative, then the parabola goes left, if it is positive, it goes right.

. If a is negative, then the parabola goes left, if it is positive, it goes right.

title: Direction
text: Since our a is negative, what does this tell us about our parabola?

title: Left Direction
text: Since our a is negative, we know that our parabola will open up towards the left.
speech: Since our a is negative, we know that our parabola will open up towards the left.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: To find the vertex, we need to find the axis is symmetry, which is found using the formula, $$y=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: Our $$b$$ and a are $$-2$$ and $$-1$$ respectively. Our axis of symmetry is $$y=-1\frac{2}{2}$$.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Now that we have our axis of symmetry, we want to plug it back into the original equation to find the $$x$$ value of our vertex.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Since our $$y$$ is $$-1$$, we plug it into our equation as, $$x=-\left(1^2\right)-2\times-1+3$$. This gives us $$x=4$$.

title: Finding the y-intercepts
text: We must factor the GCF from our equation and factor the trinomial. After this, we solve for $$y$$, which are $$-3$$ and $$1$$ in this case, so the x-intercepts are $$(0,-3)$$ and $$(0,1)$$.
